lib/dcbpb.c

00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief   Degree constarined bottleneck paths bound
00003  *
00004  *  Implemenation of the degree constrained bottleneck paths bound (DCBPB) 
00005  *  used as a lower bound for the Bottleneck TSP objective value.
00006  *
00007  *  @author  John LaRusic
00008  *  @ingroup lib
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "arrow.h"
00011 
00012 /**
00013  *  @brief  Solves the all-pairs bottleneck paths problem (a simple
00014  *          modification of the Floyd-Warshall alg for all-pairs shortest
00015  *          paths).
00016  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00017  *  @param  ignore [in] vertex number to ignore
00018  *  @param  b [out] array will hold bottleneck path value for each
00019  *              pair of source/sink nodes
00020  */
00021 void
00022 bottleneck_paths(arrow_problem *problem, int ignore, int **b);
00023 
00024 /*
00025  *  @brief  Returns the max of the three values
00026  *  @param  i [in] first number
00027  *  @param  j [in] second number
00028  *  @param  k [in] third number
00029  *  @return the largest of i, j, k
00030  */
00031 int
00032 max(int i, int j, int k);
00033 
00034 /****************************************************************************
00035  * Public function implemenations
00036  ****************************************************************************/
00037 int
00038 arrow_dcbpb_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_bound_result *result)
00039 {
00040     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00041     int i, j, k;
00042     int delta, bottleneck, max_tree, min_node;
00043     int in_cost, out_cost;
00044     int n = problem->size;
00045     double start_time, end_time;    
00046     
00047     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00048     
00049     int **b;
00050     int *b_space;
00051     if(!arrow_util_create_int_matrix(n, n, &b, &b_space))
00052     {
00053         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00054         goto CLEANUP;
00055     }
00056     bottleneck = INT_MIN;
00057 
00058     for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00059     {
00060         bottleneck_paths(problem, i, b);
00061         min_node = INT_MAX;
00062         
00063         for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00064         {
00065             if(j != i)
00066             {
00067                 delta = INT_MIN;
00068                 for(k = 0; k < n; k++)
00069                 {
00070                     if((k != j) && (k != i))
00071                     {
00072                         if(b[j][k] > delta) delta = b[j][k];
00073                     }
00074                 }
00075                 
00076                 for(k = 0; k < n; k++)
00077                 {
00078                     if((k != i) && (k != j))
00079                     {
00080                         out_cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00081                         in_cost = problem->get_cost(problem, k, i);
00082                         max_tree = max(delta, out_cost, in_cost);
00083                         if(max_tree < min_node) min_node = max_tree;
00084                     }
00085                 }
00086             }
00087         }
00088         
00089         if(bottleneck < min_node)
00090             bottleneck = min_node;
00091     }
00092     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00093 
00094     result->obj_value = bottleneck;
00095     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00096     
00097 CLEANUP:
00098     if(b_space != NULL) free(b_space);
00099     if(b != NULL) free(b);
00100     return ret;
00101 }
00102 
00103 /****************************************************************************
00104  * Private function implemenations
00105  ****************************************************************************/
00106 void
00107 bottleneck_paths(arrow_problem *problem, int ignore, int **b)
00108 {
00109     int i, j, k, max;
00110     
00111     /* Initialize! */
00112     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00113     {
00114         for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00115             b[i][j] = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00116         b[i][i] = INT_MAX;
00117     }
00118     
00119     /* Dynamic programming technique GO! */
00120     for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00121     {
00122         if(k != ignore)
00123         {
00124             for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00125             {
00126                 if((i != ignore) && (k != i))
00127                 {
00128                     for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00129                     {
00130                         if((j != ignore) && (k != j) && (i != j))
00131                         {
00132                             max = (b[i][k] > b[k][j] ? b[i][k] : b[k][j]);
00133                             if(max < b[i][j])
00134                                 b[i][j] = max;
00135                         }
00136                     }
00137                 }
00138             }
00139         }
00140     }
00141 }
00142 
00143 int
00144 max(int i, int j, int k)
00145 {
00146     int max = i;
00147     if(max < j) max = j;
00148     if(max < k) max = k;
00149     return max;
00150 }
